text: [Music]
hi I'm sue Boyer a cloud support
associate here in the AWS office in Cape
Town today I'm going to show you how to
install a windows feature like net
framework 3.5 on an amazon ec2 instance
so let's get started
after you signing in to the AWS
management console
navigate to the Amazon ec2 console
select running instances select the
instance that you want to install the
feature true then verify the
availability zone that the instance
resides in my instance is in US east 1a
after that on the Left navigation pane
select snapshots choose public snapshots
as opposed to owned by me search for the
Windows version that's your instance is
running my instance is running Windows
2016 then select the snapshot that
matches your system architecture and
language preferences in my case it's
Windows 2016 English installation media
choose actions then choose create volume
be sure that the availability zone
matches the one that the instance is in
choose create volume when the create
volume requests exceeded message shows
up choose the volume ID now we'll attach
the created volume to the instance
choose actions and then touch volume
select the instance ID and then choose a
touch now we'll connect to our instance
and first be sure that the volume is
attached now that we have connected to
the instance we can first check by going
to file explorer choose this PC we can
see that the volume is not showing up
let's go to Disk Management by
right-clicking on Windows Start menu and
then choose disk management we can see
that the disk is offline so let's
right-click on the disk and choose
online after that the volume will appear
now we'll install dotnet framework using
the add roles and features wizard let's
go to control panel choose 10 Windows
Features on or off they success with the
server manager dashboard choose next
she's next again well role-based feature
or feature based media installation is
selected select the target server select
next on server roles page select donate
framework 3.5 feature and choose next on
the confirm installation selections
specify an alternate source path my
installation media is in drive D sources
and then s X s
I'll enter the path and then choose ok
after that choose installer as you can
see the feature has been installed
thanks for watching and happy cloud
computing from all of us here at AWS
